Yes, the University of Nottingham has a range of specialist support staff who work with students from marginalized backgrounds. Here is more information about some of these support services:

1. The Disability Support Team: This team provides support to students with disabilities, including physical, sensory, and mental health conditions. The support includes advice on disability-related issues, adjustments to learning environments, and exam arrangements.

2. The Student Services Centre: This team provides advice and support to students on a range of issues, including accommodation, finances, and personal issues. They also offer specialist support for specific groups of students, such as carers and estranged students.

3. The Faith and Spirituality Centre: This team provides support to students of all faiths and beliefs, including spiritual and religious guidance, interfaith activities and events, and support for students experiencing faith-related or spiritual issues.

To access these services, you can visit the Student Services Centre in person or contact them via email or phone to book an appointment. The Disability Support Team also has a self-referral form that you can complete online to request support. The Faith and Spirituality Centre is open to all students and does not require any appointment or prior contact.
